TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He is an oil producer .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date criminal proceedings were brought against the applicant , who was charged with attempted extortion , attempted arson and arson , and ( under Article CARDINAL bis of LAW ) with being a member of a mafia - type criminal association based in GPE .

CARDINAL . By an order of CARDINAL DATE , the GPE preliminary investigations judge ( giudice per le indagini preliminari ) , considering that there were “ substantial indications ” of the applicant ’s guilt , remanded him in custody . As to the existence of special requirements ( esigenze cautelari ) justifying his detention pending trial under LAW , the preliminary investigations judge observed that on account of his involvement in a criminal organisation the applicant had contacts which might enable him to reoffend , abscond , or pervert the course of justice . Moreover , given that the applicant had also been charged with the offence provided for under LAW , the requirements referred to in LAW were to be presumed to have been met unless there was proof to the contrary .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against the order of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . By an order of CARDINAL DATE , the division of ORG responsible for reviewing precautionary measures ( “ the Specialised Division ” ) , finding that the preliminary investigations judge had not correctly assessed the evidence of the applicant ’s guilt , set aside the order of CARDINAL DATE and ordered the applicant ’s release .
CARDINAL . NORP The public prosecutor ’s office appealed on points of law . It alleged in particular that ORG had given the reasons for its decision in an illogical and contradictory manner .
CARDINAL . ORG set the case down for a hearing on DATE . No summons to appear was served on the applicant or his lawyer .
CARDINAL . The hearing was held on the scheduled date .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , ORG quashed the order of DATE , finding it to have been illogical and contradictory . It remitted the case to ORG , indicating the legal principles to which the ORG should adhere .

CARDINAL . ORG set the case down for a hearing on DATE . On that date Mr PERSON sought leave to produce additional evidence . He also argued that the judgment of CARDINAL DATE was null and void as he had not been informed of the date of the hearing . He alleged that Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , which provided that grounds of nullity that had not been examined previously could not be submitted before the court to which the case was remitted , breached the rights of the defence . Consequently , he requested that the provision in question be waived .
CARDINAL . ORG agreed to the inclusion of the new evidence requested by PERSON . Relying on LAW , it dismissed the objection that the judgment of DATE was null and void .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the preliminary investigations judge ’s order of DATE in respect of CARDINAL of the charges and set aside the remaining provisions .
CARDINAL . The applicant was then arrested and remanded in custody .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG , again claiming that the judgment of DATE was null and void , and alleging that LAW was unconstitutional and breached the rights of the defence .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , ORG , considering that the decision appealed against had been logically and properly reasoned , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law . It considered manifestly ill - founded the objection that LAW was unconstitutional .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , in a judgment of DATE , the GPE preliminary hearings judge ( giudice dell’udienza preliminare ) had convicted the applicant . The length of the sentence is not known .

CARDINAL . NORP In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG acquitted the applicant on the ground that he had not committed the offences with which he had been charged ( per non aver commesso il fatto ) .
